Detailed Description

template<typename T, T min, T max>
class cubescript::bounded_variable< T, min, max >

Bounded variable symbol.

An exception is thrown when an out-of-bound value is attempted to be assigned, in such a case, the value stored previously is restored.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T, T min, T max>
std::string cubescript::bounded_variable< T, min, max >::apply ( std::list< std::string > &  args,
domain *   
) [inline, virtual]

Assign value to variable.

Expects one argument only, providing any more arguments will result in an exception being thrown. The value passed is expected to have a string representation that can be lexically casted to the variable's type, incompatible notation will result in an exception being thrown.

Reimplemented from cubescript::variable_base< T >.
